    • Method Detail

      • findConstructor

        public static <T> Constructor<T> findConstructor(Class<T> type,
                                 Class<?>... clazzes)
                                      throws NoSuchMethodException,
                                             ClassNotFoundException
        Returns a Constructor object that reflects the specified constructor of the given type.

        If no parameter types are specified i.e., paramTypes is null or empty, the default constructor is returned.
        If a parameter type is not known i.e., it is null, all declared constructors are checked whether their parameter types conform to the known parameter types i.e., if every known type is assignable to the parameter type of the constructor and if exactly one was found, it is returned.
        Otherwise a NoSuchMethodException is thrown indicating that no or several constructors were found.

        Parameters:
        type - the class
        paramTypes - the full-qualified class names of the parameters (can be null)
        classLoader - the class loader to use
        Returns:
        the accessible constructor resolved
        Throws:
        NoSuchMethodException - if there are zero or more than one constructor candidates
        ClassNotFoundException - if a class cannot be located by the specified class loader

      • findMethod

        public static Method findMethod(Class<?> type,
                String methodName,
                Class<?>... clazzes)
                         throws ClassNotFoundException
        Returns a Method with a certain name and parameter types declared in the given class or any subclass (except Object).

        If no parameter types are specified i.e., paramTypes is null the parameter types are ignored for signature comparison.
        If a parameter type is not known i.e., it is null, all declared methods are checked whether their parameter types conform to the known parameter types i.e., if every known type is assignable to the parameter type of the method and if exactly one was found, it is returned.
        Otherwise a NoSuchMethodException is thrown indicating that no or several methods were found.

        Parameters:
        type - the class
        methodName - the name of the method to find
        clazzes - the full-qualified class names of the parameters
        Returns:
        the accessible method resolved
        Throws:
        ClassNotFoundException - if a class cannot be located by the specified class loader

      • getNamesFromClasses

        public static String[] getNamesFromClasses(Class<?>... classes)
        Returns the full-qualified class names for the given classes.
        This method is the inverse of getClassesFromNames(String[], ClassLoader).
        Parameters:
        classes - the classes
        Returns:
        a non-null array of the full-qualified class names

      • getClassesFromNames

        public static Class<?>[] getClassesFromNames(String[] names,
                             ClassLoader classLoader)
                                      throws ClassNotFoundException
        Loads the classes with the given full-qualified names using the provided ClassLoader.
        This method is the inverse of getNamesFromClasses(Class[]).

        Note that unknown parameter types i.e., "null" are handled gracefully. Instead of throwing an exception, they are resolved to null instead. This allows the caller to predict the type e.g., by comparing them with method or constructor signatures.

        Parameters:
        names - the names of the classes to load
        classLoader - the class loader to use
        Returns:
        a non-null array of the classes loaded
        Throws:
        ClassNotFoundException - if a class cannot be located by the specified class loader
